net.foxycorndog.jfoxylib.opengl

Class GL

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.foxycorndog.jfoxylib.opengl.GL

  • public class GL
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that has several static methods used for manipulating OpenGL capabilities and other things.
    Since:
    Feb 15, 2013 at 11:43:44 PM, v0.1
    Version:
    May 23, 2013 at 2:28:44 PM, v0.2
    Author:
    Braden Steffaniak

      Translates the current matrix configuration the specified amounts.

      The difference between this and the translate() method is that this method translates on a pixel basis, not on a scaled basis.

    • Method Detail

      • viewOrtho

        public static void viewOrtho(int width,
             int height)
        Initialize the orthographic view mode. This mode is used for 2 dimensional viewing.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of each OpenGL unit per pixel.
        height - The height of each OpenGL unit per pixel.

      • viewPerspective

        public static void viewPerspective(int width,
                   int height,
                   float zClose,
                   float zFar)
        Initialize the OpenGL perspective viewing mode.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the Frame of reference.
        height - The height of the Frame of reference.
        zClose - The closest index to the screen possible for the zed axis.
        zFar - The farthest index to the screen possible for the zed axis.

      • getTextureScaleMinMethod

        public static int getTextureScaleMinMethod()
        Get the integer variable that represents the method of minification for OpenGL Textures.
        Returns:

      • getTextureScaleMagMethod

        public static int getTextureScaleMagMethod()
        Get the integer variable that represents the method of magnification for OpenGL Textures.
        Returns:
        The integer variable that represents the method of magnification for OpenGL Textures.

      • setTextureScaleMinMethod

        public static void setTextureScaleMinMethod(int method)
        Set the Texture minification method when rendering Textures. Possible methods include:
        NEAREST - Minify the Texture exactly as it is, with loss of pixels.
        LINEAR - Minify the Texture with estimation.
        Parameters:
        method - The method to set the minification to.

      • setTextureScaleMagMethod

        public static void setTextureScaleMagMethod(int method)
        Set the Texture magification method when rendering Textures. Possible methods include:
        NEAREST - Magnify the Texture exactly as it is, without estimation.
        LINEAR - Magnify the Texture with estimation.
        Parameters:
        method - The method to set the magnification to.

      • getTextureWrapSMethod

        public static int getTextureWrapSMethod()
        Get the method that is used wrap Textures when they are rendered. This only effects the horizontal view of the Texture.
        Possible methods include:
        CLAMP - When the object the Texture is rendered to is too large for the Texture, clamp the Texture by continuing the colors closest to the edge onward.
        REPEAT - When the object the Texture is rendered to is too large for the Texture, repeat the Texture to fill the empty space.
        Returns:
        The method that is used wrap Textures when they are rendered horizontally.

      • getTextureWrapTMethod

        public static int getTextureWrapTMethod()
        Get the method that is used wrap Textures when they are rendered. This only effects the vertical view of the Texture.
        Possible methods include:
        CLAMP - When the object the Texture is rendered to is too large for the Texture, clamp the Texture by continuing the colors closest to the edge onward.
        REPEAT - When the object the Texture is rendered to is too large for the Texture, repeat the Texture to fill the empty space.
        Returns:
        The method that is used wrap Textures when they are rendered vertically.

      • setTextureWrapSMethod

        public static void setTextureWrapSMethod(int method)
        Set the method to wrap Textures when they are rendered. This only effects the horizontal view of the Texture.
        Possible methods include:
        CLAMP - When the object the Texture is rendered to is too large for the Texture, clamp the Texture by continuing the colors closest to the edge onward.
        REPEAT - When the object the Texture is rendered to is too large for the Texture, repeat the Texture to fill the empty space.
        Parameters:
        method - The method to set the horizontal Texture wrap method.

      • setTextureWrapTMethod

        public static void setTextureWrapTMethod(int method)
        Set the method to wrap Textures when they are rendered. This only effects the vertical view of the Texture.
        Possible methods include:
        CLAMP - When the object the Texture is rendered to is too large for the Texture, clamp the Texture by continuing the colors closest to the edge onward.
        REPEAT - When the object the Texture is rendered to is too large for the Texture, repeat the Texture to fill the empty space.
        Parameters:
        method - The method to set the vertical Texture wrap method.

        public static void enableInverting()

      • beginInverting

        public static void beginInverting(int mode)
        Begin inverting everything rendered with the specified mode.
        The modes include:
        CLEAR -
        SET -
        COPY -
        COPY_INVERTED -
        NOOP -
        INVERT -
        AND -
        NAND -
        OR -
        NOR -
        XOR -
        EQUIV -
        AND_REVERSE -
        AND_INVERTED -
        OR_REVERSE -
        OR_INVERTED -
        Parameters:
        mode - The mode in which to begin inverting.

      • beginInvertingNormal

        public static void beginInvertingNormal()

      • beginClipping

        public static void beginClipping(int x,
                 int y,
                 int width,
                 int height)
        Clip the area that will be rendered inside of to the screen. The difference between this method and beginFrameClipping(int, int, int, int) is that this method takes into account the current scale amount and amount translated.
        Parameters:
        x - The horizonal location to make the clip.
        y - The vertical location to make to clip.
        width - The horizontal size of the area to clip.
        height - The vertical size of the area to clip.

      • endClipping

        public static void endClipping()
        Stop clipping what is rendered to the screen.

      • beginFrameClipping

        public static void beginFrameClipping(int x,
                      int y,
                      int width,
                      int height)
        Clip the area that will be rendered inside of to the screen. The difference between this method and beginClipping(int, int, int, int) is that this method does not takes into account the current scale amount, and is based on pixels. It also takes the absolute position from the screen.
        Parameters:
        x - The horizonal location to make the clip.
        y - The vertical location to make to clip.
        width - The horizontal size of the area to clip.
        height - The vertical size of the area to clip.

      • endFrameClipping

        public static void endFrameClipping()
        Stop clipping what is rendered to the screen.

      • rotate

        public static void rotate(float x,
          float y,
          float z)
        Rotates everything that is rendered after this method call the specified x, y, and z amounts.
        Rotates the current matrix configuration the specified amounts.
        Parameters:
        x - How many degrees to rotate around the x axis.
        y - How many degrees to rotate around the y axis.
        z - How many degrees to rotate around the z axis.

      • translate

        public static void translate(float x,
             float y,
             float z)
        Translate everything that is rendered after this method call the specified x, y, and z amounts.
        Translates the current matrix configuration the specified amounts.
        Parameters:
        x - The amount to translate along the x (horizontal) axis.
        y - The amount to translate along the y (vertical) axis.
        z - The amount to translate along the z (oblique) axis.

      • translateIgnoreScale

        public static void translateIgnoreScale(float x,
                        float y,
                        float z)
        Translate everything that is rendered after this method call the specified x, y, and z amounts.
        Translates the current matrix configuration the specified amounts.

        The difference between this and the translate() method is that this method translates on a pixel basis, not on a scaled basis. What this means is that no matter what the scale is, this will translate the scene the same amount.

        This is essentially the same as calling this method:
        translate(x / scaleX, y / scaleY, z / scaleZ);
        Parameters:
        x - The amount to translate along the x (horizontal) axis.
        y - The amount to translate along the y (vertical) axis.
        z - The amount to translate along the z (oblique) axis.

      • unscale

        public static void unscale()
        Set the scale of the current matrix back to (1, 1, 1).

      • scale

        public static void scale(float x,
         float y,
         float z)
        Scale everything that is rendered after this method call the specified amount int the x, y, and z axis.
        Scales the current matrix configuration the specified amounts.
        Parameters:
        x - The amount to scale horizontally what is rendered.
        y - The amount to scale vertically what is rendered.
        z - The amount to scale obliquely what is rendered.

      • getAmountScaled

        public static float[] getAmountScaled()
        Get the amount that the current matrix has been scaled up to this method call.
        Returns:
        A float array containing three values that correspond to the (x, y, z) amount scaled.

        public static float[] getAmountTranslated()
        Get the amount that the current matrix has been translated by up to this method call.
        Returns:
        A float array containing three values that correspond to the (x, y, z) amount translated.

        Get the amount that the current matrix has been rotated by up to this method call.
        Returns:
        A float array containing three values that correspond to the (x, y, z) amount rotated.

      • getTextureTolerance

        public static float getTextureTolerance()
        Get the tolerance in which the Textures will be generated with. This determines how far to keep from overlapping textures on a SpriteSheet or image.
        Returns:
        The tolerance in which the Textures will be generated with.

      • setTextureTolerance

        public static void setTextureTolerance(float textureTolerance)
        Set the tolerance in which the Textures will be generated with. This determines how far to keep from overlapping textures on a SpriteSheet or image.
        Parameters:
        textureTolerance - The tolerance in which the Textures will be generated with.

      • getVertexTolerance

        public static float getVertexTolerance()
        Set the tolerance in which the Vertices will be generated with. This determines how much of a buffer to make for the vertices to make sure that no empty space is left in between any adjacent polygons.
        Returns:
        The tolerance in which the Vertices will be generated with.

      • setVertexTolerance

        public static void setVertexTolerance(float vertexTolerance)
        Get the tolerance in which the Vertices will be generated with. This determines how much of a buffer to make for the vertices to make sure that no empty space is left in between any adjacent polygons.

      • getColor

        public static Color getColor()
        Get the current color that is being used by OpenGL.
        Returns:
        A Color instance holding the values.

      • getColorArray

        public static float[] getColorArray()
        Get the current color that is being used by OpenGL.
        Returns:
        A float array describing the float values for the (r, g, b, a) color in the current state.

      • setColor

        public static void setColor(float r,
            float g,
            float b,
            float a)
        Set the color that everything rendered will be affected by. Accepts values (0 - 1).
        Parameters:
        r - The red component (0.0 - 1.0).
        g - The green component (0.0 - 1.0).
        b - The blue component (0.0 - 1.0).
        a - The alpha component (0.0 - 1.0).

      • setColor

        public static void setColor(Color color)
        Set the color that everything rendered will be affected by. Accepts values (0 - 1).
        Parameters:
        color - A Color instance that describes a rgba Color.

      • setColor

        public static void setColor(float[] color)
        Set the color that everything rendered will be affected by. Accepts values (0 - 1).
        Parameters:
        color - A 4 float large array that contains the (r, g, b, a) values in order.

      • genRectVerts

        public static float[] genRectVerts(float x,
                   float y,
                   float width,
                   float height)
        Generate a float array containing values that describe a 2 dimensional rectangle's vertices.
        Parameters:
        x - The horizontal location of the rectangle.
        y - The vertical location of the rectangle.
        width - The width of the rectangle.
        height - The height of the rectangle.
        Returns:
        The generated float array containing the values.

      • genRectVerts

        public static float[] genRectVerts(float x,
                   float y,
                   float z,
                   float width,
                   float height)
        Generate a float array containing values that describe a 2 dimensional rectangle's vertices with depth.
        Parameters:
        x - The horizontal location of the rectangle.
        y - The vertical location of the rectangle.
        z - The oblique location of the rectangle (depth).
        width - The width of the rectangle.
        height - The height of the rectangle.
        Returns:
        The generated float array containing the values.

      • genRectTextures

        public static float[] genRectTextures(Texture texture)
        Generate a float array containing values that describe a 2 dimensional rectangle's texture coordinates to map on vertices.
        Parameters:
        texture - The texture to generate the values for.
        Returns:
        The generated float array containing the values.

      • genRectTextures

        public static float[] genRectTextures(Texture texture,
                      int rx,
                      int ry)
        Generate a float array containing values that describe a 2 dimensional rectangle's texture coordinates to map on vertices. The texture will be repeated the specified amount on each of the axiis.
        Parameters:
        texture - The texture to generate the values for.
        rx - The amount of times to repeat the Texture horizontally.
        ry - The amount of times to repeat the Texture vertically.
        Returns:
        The generated float array containing the values.

      • genRectTextures

        public static float[] genRectTextures(Texture texture,
                      boolean mirrorHorizontal,
                      boolean mirrorVertical)
        Generate a float array containing values that describe a 2 dimensional rectangle's texture coordinates to map on vertices. The texture can be mirrored horizontally and/or vertically depending on the values passed to the parameters.
        Parameters:
        texture - The texture to generate the values for.
        mirrorHorizontal - Whether or not to mirror the Texture horizontally.
        mirrorVertical - Whether or not to mirror the Texture vertically.
        Returns:
        The generated float array containing the values.

      • genRectTextures

        public static float[] genRectTextures(float[] offsets)
        Generate a float array containing values that describe a 2 dimensional rectangle's texture coordinates to map on vertices.
        Parameters:
        offsets - The offsets of the Texture that will be used to generate the float array.
        Returns:
        The generated float array containing the values.

                      int rx,
                      int ry,
                      boolean mirrorHorizontal,
                      boolean mirrorVertical)

      • genCubeVerts

        public static float[] genCubeVerts(float x,
                   float y,
                   float z,
                   float width,
                   float height,
                   float depth)
        Generate a float array containing values that describe a 3 dimensional cube's vertices.
        Parameters:
        x - The horizontal location of the cube.
        y - The vertical location of the cube.
        z - The oblique location of the cube.
        width - The width of the cube.
        height - The height of the cube.
        depth - The depth of the cube.
        Returns:
        The generated float array containing the values.

      • genRectColors

        public static float[] genRectColors(float r,
                    float g,
                    float b,
                    float a)
        Generate a float array containing values that describe an (r, g, b, a) color's values that are used for Color Buffers.
        Parameters:
        r - The red component of the Color (0.0 - 1.0).
        g - The green component of the Color (0.0 - 1.0).
        b - The blue component of the Color (0.0 - 1.0).
        a - The alpha component of the Color (0.0 - 1.0).
        Returns:
        The generated float array containing the values.
